## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been thinking about VerusIDs and I was wondering, why are they limited to only being used on the Verus network?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, VerusIDs are not limited to only being used on the Verus network. The VerusID protocol can be implemented on non-Verus systems as well. They can be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network, and even beyond. You can use VerusIDs on other networks and systems, giving you more flexibility and control over your digital identity and assets.

**User:**
That's great to know! I've also been looking into Verus DeFi and I was wondering, are Verus DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets only available for a select few?

**AI Assistant:**
No, Verus DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets are not limited to a select few. Any ID owner can define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. This means that anyone can create and participate in Verus DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets, giving you more control over your assets and investments. ### Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
### Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protoc
